member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent
member.summary:
The base for every AI agent, with the aim to produce 'intelligence' using a generic model, that be modified to use different algorithms for solve a problem.
A generic agent is made up of the following components: (A) Action Space which is the set of all possible actions the agent can perform. (B) Problem Space, which contains the current state of the world the agent can perceive, the desired state of the world the agent wants to be in. (C) Agent solver, which takes the problem space and turns it into a sequence of operations of the action space.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.ActionSpace
member.summary: Gets the action space, which contains the set of all possible operations the agent can perform.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.Solver
member.summary: The solver which attempts to solve the problem of this agent with one or more algorithms.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.CurrentOperation
member.summary: The current operation that the agent is undertaking to achieve said desired space.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.CurrentProblemSpace
member.summary: Gets the current problem space, which contains what the agent can perceive, and methods to predict for some operations.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.Info
member.summary: Gets or sets additional information about the agent.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.DesiredProblemSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired problem space, which contains what the agent wants to perceive.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.ProblemDivisionQueue
member.summary: Gets the queue of desired problem spaces. When using the guide function, it populates this queue so that our desired spaces are reached sequentially.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.#ctor(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentActionSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentSolver,SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInfo)
member.summary: Constructs an agent for the sole purpose of deploying actions in the action space, to solve the problem defined in the problem space.
member.param: the space containing the set of all possible actions the agent can perform
the problem which the agent has initially
a solver for th a
additional agent information (does not affect the agent)

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.Guide(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace[])
member.summary: Guides the agent into desiring a certain state first before finally reaching the desired space.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.Solve
member.summary: Update the agent along-side the perception of the world, and attempt to solve the problem the agent currently faces. If no desired problem space is defined, then it will do nothing.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.Execute
member.summary: Attempts to execute or continue the current operation if it exists.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.ExecuteAll
member.summary: Attempts to completely execute (finish) the current operation if it exists.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.UpdateProblem(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace)
member.summary: Updates the current problem space.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.UpdateProblemUsingPrediction(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentOperation)
member.summary: Updates the current problem space, by branching from the current space by using prediction of what a given operation will do to the space.
member.param: the operation to predict from

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent.UpdateProblemUsingPrediction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the current problem space, by branching from the current space by using prediction of what a given operation will do to the space.
member.param: the operation action type which may be picked up in the problem space to indicate a specific action to take.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentActionHandler
member.summary: The action handler which handles the given target of the action.
member.param: the agent to perform the action on
the target of the action (within min-max)

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentCostFunction
member.summary: The cost handler which calculates the cost of the given action.
member.param: the agent to perform the action on
the target of the action (within min-max)
member.returns: the 'cost' of the action

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentAction
member.summary: An action which can be activated to a certain range.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentAction.Name
member.summary: Name for the action for references purposes.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentAction.MinRange
member.summary: Gets the min action target for this operation (default is zero)

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentAction.MaxRange
member.summary: Gets the max action target for this operation (default is one). Inclusive.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentAction.Tag
member.summary: A tag that may be required for prediction.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentAction.Action
member.summary: Gets the action handler that performs the action on the agent's world, using an integer to specify an argument.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentAction.Cost
member.summary: Gets the cost calculation which may be used on certain solvers to determine best paths.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentAction.#ctor(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentActionHandler,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentCostFunction,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Defines a new agent operation which takes an action handler, and allows a certain range of values from (min-max) inclusive, to be passed to the handler every solution.
member.param: the action handler that performs the action on the agent's world, using an integer to specify an argument.
the cost calculation function that takes the agent, a target within min-max, and returns the estimated cost to perform the action.
the min target integer
the max target integer inclusive
tag for reference purposes

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentAction.#ctor(System.String,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentActionHandler,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentCostFunction,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Object)

member.param: name of the action for reference purposes
the action handler that performs the action on the agent's world, using an integer to specify an argument.
the cost calculation function that takes the agent, a target within min-max, and returns the estimated cost to perform the action.
the min target integer
the max target integer inclusive
tag for reference purposes

the action to check
member.returns: true if the action can be performed

member.summary: The prompt that determines

member.summary: The target in which the action is to be performed to.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentActionExecution.Active
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this execution should be checked or performed.

member.summary: Creates information for an execution of the action
member.param: the agent that this action is performed on
the action that is going to be performed
the target argument of the action
the prompt function which determines if this can be executed

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentActionSpace
member.summary: The action space contains the set all possible actions the agent can perform.

Gets a list of all single step operations that can be found from this action space.
Assumes that an integer can stored the features as a binary representation

member.summary: An additional argument of the operation.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentOperation.Steps
member.summary: The steps of the execution which must run in sequence.

member.summary: Gets the single operation target, assuming that the number of steps is one.

member.summary: Continues the execution of the operation as normal.

member.returns: a clone of this operation

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentOperation.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the operation entirely.

member.summary: Creates an operation from a single vague action type.

an additional argument that may be required for the operation
member.returns: the operation representing the action type

member.summary: Creates an operation from a single execution.

member.summary: Calculates the total cost of the operation

member.summary: Gets or sets the time this step should be performed at.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentOperationStep.Executions

the execution specifications of the actions

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentOperationStep.AsSingle

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentOperationStep.Execute(SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent)
member.summary: Executes all active executions

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace
member.summary:
An abstract class that provides the bare minimum on how an agent perceives the world.
Extended class must implement the Perceive and Predict function which returns a new problem space.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace.MatchTolerance
member.summary: The match tolerance for equals on this problem space.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace.Perceive(SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent)
member.summary: Perceives the world that the agent lives in to the agent's perspective. If this problem space is used to represent the world in its entirely, then leave as empty function.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace.DistanceTo(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace)
member.summary:
Calculates the certainty distance between two problem states. May be used in some algorithms to determine desirable actions.
The DistanceTo function is not to be confused with the heuristic function, which is the estimated cost to achieve the space/state. The Distance function is more generally how many things must change for the space to be the exact same, and is used for state comparison (how certain this state is the exact same, 0 = same)
member.param: the state to distantiate
member.returns: the real number indicating a distance to the other state from this state

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace.Heuristic(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace)
member.summary:
Estimates the distance between two problem states. May be used in some algorithms to determine desirable actions.
The Heuristic function is not to be confused with the DistanceTo function, which is the certainty distance between states. The heuristic function must provide a guide on the cost required to reach the desired space.
member.param: the state to distantiate (the desired space)
member.returns: the real number indicating an estimated distance to the other state from this state lower or equal to the actual distance

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace.Desirability(SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent)
member.summary: Calculates the desirability of this problem space.
member.returns: a value between 0 - 100% (0.0-1.0) representing how desirable this state is. At 100%, the agent assumes that it achieved perfection on all goals.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace.Predict(SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentOperation)
member.summary: Predicts the effect of an operation on a specific agent, returning the new problem space.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentSolver
member.summary: An agent solver depicts an algorithm for a tick of an agent's operation. It also provides methods on how to account for new problems. A new instance of a solver should be initiated for every agent to avoid preprocessing errors.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentSolver.MatchTolerance
member.summary: The tolerance in which a state is said to be the same. If set to 0, then the distance from one state to another to be the same must be 0.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentSolver.UpdateProblem(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent)
member.summary: Updates the solver's memory to account for the new problem as per agent.UpdateProblem.
member.param: the problem that requires solving
the problem space that the agent desires
the agent that needs solving

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentSolver.UpdateProblem(SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent)
member.summary: Updates the solver's memory to account for the new problem as per agent.UpdateProblem.
member.param: the agent that needs solving

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentSolver.Solve(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent)
member.summary: Attempts to solve the agent's current problem.
member.param: the problem that requires solving
the problem space that the agent desires
the agent that needs solving
member.returns: an operation on the agent, which should lead to the desired state

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentSolver.Solve(SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent)
member.summary: Attempts to solve the agent's current problem.
member.param: the agent that needs solving
member.returns: an operation on the agent, which should lead to the desired state

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentSolver.Check(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentOperation)
member.summary: Checks to make sure that the operation will lead to the agent's desired space.
member.param: the problem that requires solving
the problem space that the agent desires
the agent that needs solving
the current operation of the agent
member.returns: true if there are no problems with the operation

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentSolver.Check(SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentOperation)
member.summary: Checks to make sure that the operation will lead to the agent's desired space.
member.param: the agent that needs solving
the current operation of the agent
member.returns: true if there are no problems with the operation

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentComputationalLimits
member.summary: Depicts how the agent uses its available computation power to act within the world.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentComputationalLimits.Undefined
member.summary: No information is provided about the computational limits, or unknown.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentComputationalLimits.PerfectRationality
member.summary: Depicts that the agent has perfect rationality. That is, it will attempt to use any amount of computation without considerations for limits, in order to determine the best course of action.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentComputationalLimits.BoundedRationality
member.summary: Depicts that the agent makes use of available computation and memory limitations in order to determine good decisions within these limits.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentCoordination
member.summary: Depicts how the agent co-ordinates with other agents.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentCoordination.Undefined
member.summary: No information is provided about the co-ordination, or unknown.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentCoordination.SingleAgent
member.summary: Depicts that the agent does not have any knowledge of other agents, and does not need to collaborate with them.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentCoordination.MultipleAgents
member.summary: Depicts that the agent needs to reason strategically around other agents.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentEffectUncertainty
member.summary: Depicts whether an agent can determine its resulting environment state from its initial state and next action

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentEffectUncertainty.Undefined
member.summary: No information is provided about effect uncertainty, or unknown.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentEffectUncertainty.Deterministic
member.summary: Depicts that the agent can predict the exact state from any state and action.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentEffectUncertainty.Stochastic
member.summary: Depicts that the agent cannot predict the exact state from any state and action.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInfo
member.summary: Contains information relevant to the environment that an agent acts within.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInfo.Modularity
member.summary: Gets or sets the modularity information of the agent.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInfo.PlanningHorizon
member.summary: Gets or sets the planning horizon information of the agent.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInfo.Representation
member.summary: Gets or sets the representation information of the agent.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInfo.ComputationalLimits
member.summary: Gets or sets the computational limit information of the agent.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInfo.Learning
member.summary: Gets or sets the learning type information of the agent.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInfo.SensingUncertainty
member.summary: Gets or sets the sensing uncertainty information of the agent.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInfo.EffectUncertainty
member.summary: Gets or sets the effect uncertainty information of the agent.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInfo.Preference
member.summary: Gets or sets the preference information of the agent.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInfo.NumberOfAgents
member.summary: Gets or sets the coordination information of the agent.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInfo.Interaction
member.summary: Gets or sets the interaction time information of the agent.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInteractionTime
member.summary: Depicts when the agent must reason.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInteractionTime.Undefined
member.summary: No information is provided about the agent's interaction time, or unknown.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInteractionTime.Offline
member.summary: Depicts that the agent must reason before acting within the environment.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentInteractionTime.Online
member.summary: Depicts that the agent must reason while acting within the environment.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentLearningType
member.summary: Depicts how the agent responds to new environments.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentLearningType.Undefined
member.summary: No information is provided about the learning type, or unknown.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentLearningType.KnowledgeIsGiven
member.summary: Depicts that the agent cannot learn in new environments, and is mostly incompatible with new environments.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentLearningType.KnowledgeIsLearned
member.summary: Depicts that the agent is capable of learning in new environments.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentModularity
member.summary: Depicts information about the modularity of the agent, which is the extent in which the system can be decomposed into interacting modules.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentModularity.Undefined
member.summary: No information is provided about the modularity, or unknown.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentModularity.Flat
member.summary: The model has only one level of abstraction

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentModularity.Modular
member.summary: The model has multiple modules that is understood seperately.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentModularity.Hierarchical
member.summary: The model is recursively decomposed into seperate modules.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentPlanningHorizon
member.summary: Depicts how far the agent looks into the future when deciding what to do. (may vary with solver)

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentPlanningHorizon.Undefined
member.summary: No information is provided about the planning horizon, or unknown.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentPlanningHorizon.Static
member.summary: Depicts a horizon where the world does not change.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentPlanningHorizon.FiniteStage
member.summary: Depicts a horizon where the agent reasons from a fixed number of time steps.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentPlanningHorizon.IndefiniteStage
member.summary: Depicts a horizon where the agent reasons about a finite, but not predetermined, number of time steps.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentPlanningHorizon.InfiniteStage
member.summary: Depicts a horizon where the agent plans forever.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentPreferences
member.summary: Depicts what the agent is attempting to achieve

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentPreferences.Undefined
member.summary: No information is provided about the preferences, or unknown.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentPreferences.AchievementGoal
member.summary: Depicts that the agent is trying to achieve a single state (noted as the goal)

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentPreferences.ComplexPreferences
member.summary: Depicts that the agent has complex preferences, which may involve two or more goals.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentPreferences.ComplexOrdinalPreferences
member.summary: Depicts that the complex preferences of this agent is ordered. (i.e. what must be achieved first)

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentPreferences.ComplexCardinalPreferences
member.summary: Depicts that absolute values relating to complex preferences are important to this agent.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentRepresentation
member.summary: Depicts information about how an agent can reason

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentRepresentation.Undefined
member.summary: No information is provided about the representation, or unknown.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentRepresentation.ExplicitStates
member.summary: Depicts that the agent reasons about explicit (unique) states, which is a certain arrangement of the environment.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentRepresentation.Features
member.summary: Depicts that the agent reasons about features or propositions (true/false)

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentRepresentation.IndividualsAndRelations
member.summary: Depicts that the agent reasons based on relations on individuals.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentSensingUncertainty
member.summary: Depicts whether an agent can determine its resulting environment state from its inputs.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentSensingUncertainty.Undefined
member.summary: No information is provided about sensing uncertainty, or unknown.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentSensingUncertainty.FullyObservable
member.summary: Depicts that the agent can observe the state of the world.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.Agent.Info.AgentSensingUncertainty.PartiallyObservable
member.summary: Depicts that the agent knows there are a number of states from the inputs.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.AStarSolver
member.summary:
Depicts a A* Search solver for an AI agent.
A* Search has the following:
* To be used for solving a problem all at once (resulting in a set of subsequently achievable states)
* Assumes that actions are deterministic
* Requires Heuristic, Hash and Equals to be implemented in problem space
+ Path detection, but not always optimal
+ Unlike GBFS, considers action costs. - Much faster than BFS or UCS, but performance generating an optimal path requires a good heuristic.
- Depends on exact state computation
- An informed search algorithm requiring a heuristic function to be implemented.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.AStarSolver.Solve(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent)
member.summary: Solves the agent by using Greedy Best First Search to generate an operation that computes the closest path while accounting for action costs.
member.param: the agent to solve
member.returns: an operation attempts to lead the agent to the desired space

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.BFSSolver
member.summary:
Depicts a BFS solver for an AI agent.
BFS has the following:
* To be used for solving a problem all at once (resulting in a set of subsequently achievable states)
* Assumes that actions are deterministic
* Requires Hash and Equals to be implemented in problem space
+ Shortest path detection with no action cost
+ Perfect rationality but heavy memory consumption for every state
- Heavy memory consumption for exponential states, however guiding the agent into sub-problems may alleviate this problem.
- Depends on exact state computation
- A blind search algorithm

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.BFSSolver.Solve(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent)
member.summary: Solves the agent by using BFS to generate an operation that computes the closest path without accounting for action costs.
member.param: the agent to solve
member.returns: an operation attempts to lead the agent to the desired space

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.Elimination.EliminationSolver
member.summary:
Depicts a solver by elimination of subproblems for an AI agent.
Elimination Solver has the following:
* To be used for solving a problem that can be solved via elimination of actions and targets.
* SubproblemGenerator must be implemented, which populates a decreasing list of targets that can be eliminated via a use of an action (on initial state only)
* Refactor must be implemented, which * Assumes that actions are deterministic
* Does not use prediction to check actions for a particular state, and instead assumes that all actions are possible and will result in a state where the subproblem is removed after choosing an action. * Does not attempt to move to the desired space, and instead eliminates subproblems with certainty (possible action count on particular problem = 1)
+ Can be used for complex problems such as sudoku, which has no known solution from the start
- Assumes that actions are targets only (no ranges)
- Actions that lead to a undesired state are unaccounted for

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.Elimination.EliminationSolver.SubproblemGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets the generator for an initial problem space.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.Elimination.EliminationSolver.Refactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the refactoring for how any action affects given subproblem.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.Elimination.EliminationSolver.StateRefactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the refactoring for how any action affects the given world state (subproblem tag references may be updated)

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.Elimination.EliminationSubproblem
member.summary: Depicts a subproblem for an elimination solver, which contains a number of actions that could be applied to a particular target.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.Elimination.EliminationSubproblem.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the target of this subproblem for reference.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.Elimination.EliminationSubproblem.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the tag of the problem which may be used to store information outside of the subproblem, but is relevant to the subproblem.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.Elimination.EliminationSubproblem.Actions
member.summary: Gets or sets the particular actions that could occur and effect this particular target.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.Elimination.EliminationSubproblem.RequiredAction
member.summary:
Gets or sets the required action that will eliminate this subproblem on the next iteration it receives.
Can be used to simplify logic when actions may conflict.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.GBFSSolver
member.summary:
Depicts a Greedy Best-First Search solver for an AI agent.
Greedy Best-First Search has the following:
* To be used for solving a problem all at once (resulting in a set of subsequently achievable states)
* Assumes that actions are deterministic
* Requires Heuristic, Hash and Equals to be implemented in problem space
+ Path detection, but not always optimal
- Much faster than BFS or UCS, but performance generating an optimal path requires a good heuristic
- Depends on exact state computation
- An informed search algorithm requiring a heuristic function to be implemented. - Unlike A*, does not consider action costs.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.GBFSSolver.Solve(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent)
member.summary: Solves the agent by using Greedy Best First Search to generate an operation that computes the closest path while accounting for action costs.
member.param: the agent to solve
member.returns: an operation attempts to lead the agent to the desired space

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.UCSSolver
member.summary:
Depicts a UCS solver for an AI agent.
UCS has the following:
* To be used for solving a problem all at once (resulting in a set of subsequently achievable states)
* Assumes that actions are deterministic
* Requires Hash and Equals to be implemented in problem space
+ Shortest path detection with action cost
+ Perfect rationality but heavy memory consumption for every state
- Heavy memory consumption for exponential states, however guiding the agent into sub-problems may alleviate this problem.
- Depends on exact state computation
- A blind search algorithm

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.Agent.Solvers.UCSSolver.Solve(SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.AgentProblemSpace,SSDK.AI.Agent.Agent)
member.summary: Solves the agent by using UCS to generate an operation that computes the closest path while accounting for action costs.
member.param: the agent to solve
member.returns: an operation attempts to lead the agent to the desired space

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSP
member.summary: Represents an instance of a constraint satisfaction problem.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSP.Variables
member.summary: Gets or sets the variables that this CSP is interested in solving.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSP.Constraints
member.summary: Gets or sets the constraints of this satisfaction problem.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSP.IsValid
member.summary: Checks the assignment of variables against every constraint. Does not consider unassigned values.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSP.Solved
member.summary: True if the CSP was solved.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSP.IsComplete
member.summary: Checks whether all variables has a solution.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSP.AddUniqueConstraint(SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPVariable[])
member.summary: Adds a unique constraint for a list of variables (i.e. each variable must not intersect).
member.remarks:
This constraint may require a variable's solution to be disjoint within the given list, however it does impose a constraint requiring a value to be present (see AddContainmentConstraint), which may speed-up the solving of the CSP. Only effective on solved variables.
This constraint contains no hint of solving variables.
member.param: the variables which must be distinct from each other

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSP.AddContainmentConstraint(SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPVariable[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Adds a containment constraint which ensures every domain value is contained at least once within the variables.
member.remarks:
Despite being added in a single function, the number of constraints added is equal to the length of the domain values list.
This constraint contains a hint for solving variables by elimination (i.e. if no other variable can contain the value, then a particular variable must contain the value)
member.param: the variables to check
the domain value to ensure is included

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSP.AddConstraint(SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPConstraint)
member.summary: Adds a unique constraint for a list of variables (i.e. each variable must not intersect).
member.param: the variables which must be distinct from each other

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSP.ReduceVariableDomains
member.summary: Trims the domains of every variable. If any constraints fails for a particular value of an existing domain, then it is removed from the domain.
member.remarks: Trimming domains must be done before solving.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSP.Solve
member.summary: Attempts to solve the constraint satisfaction problem (i.e. the values of all variables inside the problem), giving the first solution.
member.remarks: Each CSP can only be solved once, due to removal of domains whilst solving.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPConstraint
member.summary: Represents a constraint within a CSP (Constraint-Satisfaction-Problem)

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPConstraint.ConstraintChecker
member.summary: Gets the constraint checking function which formed this constraint

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPConstraint.ConstraintHint
member.summary:
Gets the hint of the constraint, which allows assumptions of a particular value of a variable to be made based on the dynamics of the constraint
(e.g. a containment constraint - see AddContainmentConstraint - requires that the given list of variables' domains must contain a domain value at least once, and if no other variable has the value in its domain, then a particular variable with that domain value must be solved to that value)

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPConstraint.RelatedVariables
member.summary: Gets the related variables of this constraint.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPConstraint.#ctor(SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPConstraintChecker,SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPVariable[],SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPConstraintHint,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a CSP constraint with referenced variables
member.param: the related variables of this constraint
the function to check whether the constraint holds

a hint of the constraint, which allows assumptions of a particular value of a variable to be made based on the dynamics of the constraint
(e.g. a containment constraint - see AddContainmentConstraint - requires that the given list of variables' domains must contain a domain value at least once, and if no other variable has the value in its domain, then a particular variable with that domain value must be solved to that value)

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPConstraint.Holds
member.summary: Gets whether the constraint holds

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.CSP.CSPConstraint.GetHint
member.summary: Gets the next hint of this constraint.
member.returns: (null,null) if no hint exists, or the variable and solution if it does

Represents a not equals operation on a symbol (e.g. 1 != -1) Not to be confused with the logical agreement, although this can be considered a logical connective to be used for arithmetic purposes.

member.summary: The next symbol id that will be returned on GetNextSymbolID

member.summary: Gets the next symbol ID, and increments 1 each time this function is called.
member.returns: the next symbol id

member.summary: A list of assertions that should definitely hold true regardless of the world state.

member.summary: A list of assertions passed by a query that should definitely hold true regardless of the world state. This list is immediately reset after solving.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.KB.Queries
member.summary: A lits of queries that is required to be solved or was solved.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.KB.Solved
member.summary: If true, the KB has been solved at least once.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KB.HasConflict
member.summary: Returns the first conflict within the assertions found. Only applies to solved assertions.
member.returns: a tuple of the first and second factors in a conflict, with their exception

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.KB.ExistingSymbols
member.summary: The dictionary of existing symbols, that contains all symbols ever created.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KB.GetSymbol(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the symbol from the existing symbols dictionary using the id.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KB.Solve
member.summary:
Solves the current knowledge base's assertions. Clear queries (and query assertions) before-hand. You will need to assert the necessary information for it to solve.
e.g. an undefined symbol (symbol that appears but is not asserted to be either true or false), cannot be used to solve any other symbol.
In order to solve for probabilities, logic must be in a simplified form (e.g. p ^ p -> p, p ^ !p -> false)

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KB.If(SSDK.AI.KBS.KBFactor[])
member.summary: Beginning of a query on a knowledge base
member.param: a new set of assertions relevant to the query
member.returns: this knowledge base

member.summary: Resolves the knowledge base, but additional solves the query based on given assertions.
member.param: the sentences to query (returned as result)
member.returns: sentencesToQuery

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBFactor.op_LessThanOrEqual(SSDK.AI.KBS.KBFactor,SSDK.AI.KBS.KBFactor)
member.summary: Implication (rhs implies lhs)

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol
member.summary: A KB Symbol which identifies a piece of information. An inverse symbol should not appear on an logical sentence, instead the KBNot should be used.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.ID
member.summary: An identifier for the symbol

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.UniqueID
member.summary: A unique identifier for the symbol.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol._AddedToKB
member.summary: If true, then the symbol has been added to a KB.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.RelationTypes
member.summary: A dictionary of relation types that might occur from this class.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.CreateRelation(SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol)
member.summary: Creates a relation from this class to a symbol. For example if this class is 'if', then this function creates a relation if(to)
member.returns: the wrapped symbol for the relation

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.SetProperty(SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol,SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol)
member.summary: Creates or sets a property onto this symbol.
member.param: property symbol
property value symbol

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.HasProperty(SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol,SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol)
member.summary: Returns true if the property with the given value exists on this symbol.
member.param: property symbol
property value symbol

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.Inverse
member.summary: Gets the inverse symbol if created (else use GetInverse)

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.IsInverse
member.summary: If true, then this symbol is an inverse symbol.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an symbol that is not linked to any KB.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.AddToKB(SSDK.AI.KBS.KB)
member.summary: Adds the symbol to the given knowledge base
member.param: knowledge base

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.IsRelationalSymbol
member.summary: If true, then the symbol is used as a class symbol.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.GetInverse(SSDK.AI.KBS.KB)
member.summary: Creates the inverse symbol (not symbol) Used in classifications (definitely not symbol).
member.param: knowledge base
member.returns: the inverse symbol

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol.Item(SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol,SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol)
member.summary: Gets a symbol relations of a class to another symbol.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBVariable
member.summary: Represents a sentence/symbol that may contain various properties or relations. Must be extended (currently KBSymbol and KBWrappedSymbol).

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBVariable.Properties
member.summary: A property that exists within this symbol (if stored in a relation, then exists as a default backup property).

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBVariable.Relations
member.summary: A set of classifications this symbol relates to.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBVariable.SetProperty(SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol,SSDK.AI.KBS.KBFactor)
member.summary: Creates or sets a property onto this symbol.
member.param: property symbol
property value symbol

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBVariable.HasProperty(SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol,SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol)
member.summary: Returns true if the property with the given value exists on this symbol.
member.param: property symbol
property value symbol

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBWrappedSymbol
member.summary:
A KB Symbol which identifies a piece of information. An inverse symbol should not appear on an logical sentence, instead the KBNot should be used.
A wrapped symbol is a symbol that joins two symbols together. E.g. is(animal), where is the outer symbol, and animal is the inner symbol.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBWrappedSymbol.Outer
member.summary: The outer symbol (relation type)

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBWrappedSymbol.Inner
member.summary: The inner symbol (to)

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBWrappedSymbol.IsInverse
member.summary: If true, then this symbol is an inverse symbol.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBWrappedSymbol.Inverse
member.summary: Gets the inverse symbol if created (else use GetInverse)

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.KBWrappedSymbol.GetInverse
member.summary: Creates the inverse symbol (not wrapped symbol) Used in classifications (definitely not symbol).
member.param: knowledge base
member.returns: the inverse symbol

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBAgreement
member.summary: A logical connective that is asserted true on P and Q match.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBAgreement.P
member.summary: Gets the symbol or logical sentence of P (left-side).

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBAgreement.Q
member.summary: Gets the symbol or logical sentence of Q (right-side).

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBAnd
member.summary: A logical connective that is asserted true when all inner sentences are also asserted true.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBAnd.Sentences
member.summary: Gets the symbol or sentence that must all be true.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBImplication
member.summary: A logical connective that is asserted true on P->Q when P is false, or Q. When using probabilities

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBImplication.Condition
member.summary: Gets the symbol or logical sentence that implies a certain assertion.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBImplication.Implication
member.summary: Gets the symbol or logical sentence that is implied by the condition.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBNot
member.summary: A logical connective that inverts the sentence wrapped.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBNot.Sentence
member.summary: Gets the symbol or sentence that if true, the assertion is false, and vice-versa.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBOr
member.summary: A logical connective that is asserted true when any inner sentences are also asserted true.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBOr.Sentences
member.summary: Gets the symbol or sentence that at least one must be true for this to be true.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBPropertyDeclaration
member.summary: A Logical Connective which identifies a piece of information about a specific relation e.g. a symbol that is(player) has sym health that is symbol (numeral 50)

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBPropertyDeclaration.Relation
member.summary: The relation or symbol that this property is declared to.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBPropertyDeclaration.Property
member.summary: The property symbol that is defined.

member.name: P:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBPropertyDeclaration.Value
member.summary: The property value that is defined.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBSolveType
member.summary: Represents the solve type that a parent can pass to a calling child.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBSolveType.NoSolution
member.summary: Represents that there is no current solution to the child.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBSolveType.Other
member.summary: Represents that this solves differently (child does not need solving) as parent will definitely handle it.

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBSolveType.SolveTrue
member.summary: Represents that the child can be asserted to be true

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBSolveType.SolveFalse
member.summary: Represents that the child can be asserted to be false

member.name: F:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBSolveType.SolveArithmetic
member.summary: Represents that the child can be solved to a certain arithmetic value. The child must call the parent's GetAltSolutionForChild.

member.name: T:SSDK.AI.KBS.Logic.KBSymbolRelation
member.summary: A Logical Connective which identifies a piece of information about a symbol

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.Symbols.KBSymbolExt_Days.CreateDaySymbols(SSDK.AI.KBS.KB,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates symbols for the days (0-Sunday, 6-Monday). max must be more than min.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.Symbols.KBSymbolExt_Days.CreateDayClassifications(SSDK.AI.KBS.KB,SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol[],SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol,SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol,SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol)
member.summary: Creates logical sentences for day classifications (e.g. yesterday of monday is sunday).

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.Symbols.SymbolExt.SelectOne(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol},System.String)
member.summary: Selects a single symbol given a string id from symbols.

member.name: M:SSDK.AI.KBS.Symbols.SymbolExt.In(SSDK.AI.KBS.KBSymbol[],SSDK.AI.KBS.KB)
member.summary: Adds all symbols in the array to the KB.
member.param: the list of symbols to add to the knowledge base
the knowledge base to add to
member.returns: the unmodified list of symbols
